meanings.definition: To release or let go of something
meanings.sent1: The firefighter discharges water onto the burning building.
meanings.sent2: She discharges her responsibilities diligently every day.
meanings.sent3: The magician discharges a puff of smoke from his sleeve, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The factory discharges waste into the river, polluting the environment.
meanings.sent5: The pressure cooker discharges steam when it reaches a high temperature.

meanings.definition: To fire a weapon or release a projectile
meanings.sent1: The soldier discharges his rifle during training exercises.
meanings.sent2: The hunter carefully discharges his shotgun while aiming at the target.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully discharge water guns at each other on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: The pirate ship discharges cannons at the enemy vessel during the battle.
meanings.sent5: The police officer discharges a warning shot into the air to disperse the crowd.

meanings.definition: To perform the duties or functions of a job or role
meanings.sent1: The nurse discharges her duties with compassion and professionalism.
meanings.sent2: He discharges the responsibilities of a team leader with efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The robot efficiently discharges its programmed tasks in the factory.
meanings.sent4: The actor discharges the role of a villain convincingly in the movie.
meanings.sent5: The teacher discharges her role as a mentor by guiding students towards success.
